info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 24 at 6:55PM CDT until August 24 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN MCLEAN...NORTH CENTRAL MORTON AND EASTERN OLIVER COUNTIES... At 654 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Washburn to 7 miles west of Wilton to 10 miles west of Mandan, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters and a mesonet station. Mesonet near Hannover observed a wind gust of 73 mph. Trained spotters near New Salem reported wind gusts of around 70 mph. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Mandan and Wilton around 700 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Cross Ranch State Park, Price, Sweet Briar Lake, Crown Butte Lake, Sanger, Hensler, Lake Harmon and Nelson Lake. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
